Using Brackets¶

There are three ways of using Brackets with Python. Easiest way is to use Brackets interpreter and shell. Brackets comes with its own shell and interpreter, to start Brackets shell, just type brackets in your command line environment, terminal or console:

brackets

this will bring up the Brackets shell, where you can write and execute Brackets code. You can use and import any Python libraries and files you want. Remember, all Brackets code is Python compatible and all Python code can run in Brackets.

If you don’t pass a file name to brackets it will bring up the Brackets shell, but if you give it a file name, it will execute that file for you:

brackets hello.bpy
